entry.title: Combined summary - Blinded Paths Doom Scenario
entry.summary: The discussion revolves around the trade-offs and challenges involved in achieving privacy on the Lightning Network. Blinded paths, which allow receiving nodes to remain anonymous, offer privacy advantages. However, there are drawbacks to this approach. One concern is that payments can only be made through specific paths, potentially limiting access to certain destinations and undermining decentralization. This reliance on regulated hubs for routing payments could bypass smaller routing nodes and raise privacy concerns.Another drawback is that as the number of hops increases, payment reliability decreases. Senders would need to maintain close connections with the introduction node or any of the nodes along the blinded path to ensure reliability. If these compliant nodes share data, sender-side privacy could be compromised through basic timing analysis.The author also raises a concern about pressure from lightning "chain analysis" companies on businesses to adopt blinded paths. This pressure may be driven by the desire to prevent receiving coins from the Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC). It remains unclear whether this issue can be resolved or if it represents a necessary trade-off for receiver privacy within the Lightning Network.In conclusion, while blinded paths offer privacy benefits, there are important considerations to take into account, including the potential limitation of payment routes, the impact on decentralization, and the compromise of sender-side privacy. The purpose of the discussion is to shed light on these issues, seek opinions, and encourage further understanding of the topic.
